title.narrative: OUTPUT 7: POLIO ERADICATION TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE

description.narrative: Technical Assistance, which contributes to Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, the most at-risk newborns and children are benefiting from integrated newborn, child health interventions and healthy behaviours.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Technical Assistance

description.narrative: UNICEF successfully secured 100 per cent funding against a total requirement of US$116.41 million for 2021 for the procurement of vaccines as per government-approved OPV mapping, operational activities of the campaign through community-based vaccination, social mobilization and communication activities. There was no cash gap during 2021 and funding for all activities was available on time. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:22/12/2021
